pageContext.claim: “You know, we went through a First World War and a Second World War and people went to vote. Now they're saying, ‘Let's use this [the coronavirus pandemic] as a chance [excuse] not to vote [in person].”
pageContext.analysis: This is a misleading comparison. War, unlike covid-19, is not a contagious disease. Many states, both Republican and Democrat, are expanding vote-by-mail options this year to prevent the spread of the novel coronavirus at traditional polling locations.
